author: National Geographic
description:
A century ago, the race to perfect color photography led to the creation of autochromes—glass plates coated with light-sensitive emulsions and a fine layer of potato starch. Microscopic particles dyed green, orange, and violet filtered light, capturing the world in vivid color. Join Sara Manco, director of the National Geographic Society’s photo and illustration archives, as she shows off some of her favorite autochromes from the 13,000 plates in the Nat Geo archives that have since been digitized. 

Learn more about the history of early color photography, autochromes, and the efforts being made to preserve them: https://on.natgeo.com/47GrqTk

Explore the World with National Geographic subscriptions: https://natgeo.com/ytngmagazine

title: Learn about the history of early color photography 📸 #NationalGeographic

author: National Geographic
description:
Join National Geographic in this Hostile Planet season 1 MEGA episode and travel around the globe to learn about how animal species survive in the world's toughest environments. Featuring full episodes: 

Mountains
Only the toughest animal species can endure the extreme weather, scarce food and limited oxygen available on the Earth’s highest mountains.  

Oceans
Dive beneath the surface of Earth’s dynamic oceans to uncover the extreme conditions to which animals must constantly adapt.  

Polar
The poles — the Earth’s most frigid habitats — are home to the ultimate survivalists, evolving to combat the intense hostility of their homes.  

Grasslands
Grasslands are home to the biggest stars of the animal kingdom, but top billing doesn’t make life here any easier as they battle volatile environments. 

Jungles
Only the most resilient species will triumph in the unpredictable jungle conditions as survival of the fittest becomes increasingly apparent.  

Deserts
Follow a host of remarkable
title: Exploring Earth's Most Extreme Climates | Hostile Planet Season 1 MEGA Episode | National Geographic
